intro: Vernonia octantha, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows up to 3 feet tall, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Vernonia octantha is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ability to support local pollinators.
